subject: Xmas Eve
event:
So it's Xmas Eve already.  Our traditional day for watching BLACKADDER'S CHRISTMAS CAROL.  Nothing like that to get you into the holiday spirit.  And remember the moral -- the bad guys get all the goodies.

I wonder if Rowan Atkinson is available for the HBO series?  I could see him as Varys.

Ho ho ho.  (Where did the year go?)

A merry xmas to all, and to all a good night.

comments.article:
Merry Christmas George!

and to everyone else too even though you guys arent as cool as George. hahah
comments.subject: Merry Christmas

comments.article:
Merry Christmas!

I agree--Rowan Atkinson would make a wonderful Varys :)

comments.upictitle: Names Is For Tombstones, Baby: Rocketeer
comments.article: Or Littlefinger.  He's short, isn't he?
Not really. You're just used to seeing him next to Hugh Laurie.

funnily enough, Blackadder's Christmas Carol is on BBC2 tomorrow (Christmas Day) evening, in the UK.

:)
And a wonderfully productive New Year! :)

That would be full of win.

Blackadder rules.
Rowan Atkinson as Varys??? See my userpic. :D
Happy Christmas, Mr. Martin.

Rowan Atkinson in Game of Thrones would Frickken Awesome(TM)!!!

Merry Christmas!
Merry X'mas, Lord Martin!! ;>

Merry Christmas!

I was introduced to Blackadder by Linda, and now we own the DVD set and watch it with disturbing regularity. It just came up as we were watching a Robin of Sherwood DVD and Linda quoted the line from series 3: "They say he's halfway to being the new Robin Hood! ... Well he steals from the rich, but he hasn't gone round to giving it to the poor yet."

comments.upictitle: inkista_: stereographic little planet Torrey Pines
comments.article: The BBC is also broadcasting a new Blackadder behind-the-scenes documentary this Christmas.

Just going around wishing all the people I care about a merry Christmas, and you ser are one of those people.

I would love to see a fat Rowan Atkinson playing the character we never know to love or hate. I think he would have the depth to pull off an amazing performance.
comments.subject: Merry Christmas

comments.article:
Merry Christmas!

Stephen Fry is surely due a role in the TV series? He could make a splendidly decadent (and erudite) Ilyrio?
Oh, yes indeed!
Blackadder's Christmas Carol... A definite necessity for Christmas Eve! :D

Rowan as Varys? Really? I'd have thought more Stephen Fry, if you're going for good old names of British comedy.

We watched Blackadder's Christmas Carol the other night, and played the associated Blackadder drinking game (drink every time someone has a Cunning Plan, drink everytime you recognise someone from something else cool, etc...).
Oh, or Jim Broadbent for Varys....  I never know how old Varys is supposed to be.
Merry Christmas, George. I'll be toasting you from the pilot house of a certain sidewheeler as we slip quietly down the Mississippi.
Have a great day! Hope you manage to get up the hill to Melinda's.

comments.upictitle: Fabricati Diem, Pvnc: Hamilton: A.Burr and A.Ham
comments.article: Dude, now I will be picturing Mr. Bean the next time I read the books! ;)
Merry Christmas to you too!  And what wonderful taste you have.  I would LOVE to see Rowan Atkinson as Varys.  He would do you proud.

We're watching The Hogfather.
Season's greetings to you and your family.

Love the gift you and my girlfriend got me--the special cover calendar!  Not sure when it will arrive (she's kinda pissed it didn't come before today, but I calmed her down with sweet sweet lovin') but it will undoubtedly be equal to the nice warm blanket and nice warm puppy she got me this year.  Thanks for being a cool dude.  Peace!
comments.subject: Merry xmas George

comments.article: I always pictured the guy who excellently played the 'town crier' in "Rome" as a PERFECT Varys :)
comments.subject: Oh, by the way

comments.article:
Ian McNeice? Excellent call. He was also the Baron Vladimir Harkonnen in the Sci-Fi Channel's adaption of DUNE and had a brilliant role as Harcourt in the BBC's seminal SF thriller EDGE OF DARKNESS.

I think we have a winner ;-)
comments.subject: Re: Oh, by the way

comments.article: Merry Christmas to you and your family!!
Merry Christmas, George!  Hopefully you won't have all the snow that we're getting up here in Dubuque!
